required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Observational Study Of The Long-Term Effect Of Macugen In Patients With Wet Age-Related Macular Degeneration
clinical_study.official_title: Long-Term Non-Interventional Study (AB Study) To Investigate The Efficacy And Safety Of MacugenÂ® In Patients With Neovascular Age-Related Macular Degeneration Under Conditions Of Routine Clinical Practice

brief_summary.textblock: Long-term observational study to assess the safety, efficacy and quality of life of patients with neovascular age-related macular degeneration (AMD) under Macugen treatment.

detailed_description.textblock: Ophthalmologists who are experienced in doing intravitreal injections in Germany

primary_outcome.measure: Visual Acuity (VA)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 6 weeks up to Month 24 or early termination
primary_outcome.description: VA measured at each follow-up visit as the number of lines read on a standard eye chart (Snellen or Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study [EDTRS]) using a 5 meter distance, 1 meter distance, or verifying if participant was able to count fingers, perceive hand motion, or light. Follow-up visits occurred only if considered part of standard medical treatment. The timeframe was as follows: Visit 1: before first injection; Visit 2: first injection; Visit 3: 6 weeks after first injection (second injection).

primary_outcome.measure: Vision-related Functioning and Quality of Life Using the National Eye Institute Visual Functioning Questionnaire-25 (NEI-VFQ-25): Overall Composite Score
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 6 months up to Month 24 or early termination
primary_outcome.description: Participant-reported vision-related functioning and quality of life measured using the 25 item NEI-VFQ-25. Converted scale 0-100 where higher score represented better functioning: General Health: item 1; General Vision: item 2; Ocular Pain: 4,19; Near Vision: 5,6,7; Distance Vision: 8,9,14; Social Functioning: 11,13; Mental Health Activities: 3,21,22,25; Role Difficulties: 17,18; Dependency: 20,23,24; Driving: 15c,16, 16a; Color Vision: 12; Peripheral Vision: 10.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Investigator Assessments of Efficacy
primary_outcome.description: Investigator's categorical assessment of the efficacy of Macugen (pegaptanib) treatment at the final visit or termination of therapy; Categories included Very Good, Good, Moderate, and Poor.

primary_outcome.measure: Lesion Size (Number of Optic Disc Areas)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 6 weeks up to Month 24 or early termination
primary_outcome.description: Lesion size measured by Investigator after each injection as part of standard of care (SOC), using standard clinical methods practiced (fluorescein or indocyanine green angiography); Reported as the number of optic-disk areas, each of which were 2.54 millimeters squared (mm^2). Lesion size included choroidal neovascularization, exudation area, and hemorrhage, if present. The timeframe was as follows: Visit 1: before first injection; Visit 3: 6 weeks after first injection (second injection).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With a Change in Activity of Neovascular Membrane at Week 6
primary_outcome.description: Neovascular membrane activity (measured by leakage) assessed by Investigator at Visit 3, as part of SOC, using standard clinical methods practiced (fluorescein or indocyanine green angiography); Categories included increased, unchanged or decreased neovascular membrane activity.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With a Change in Activity of Neovascular Membrane at Week 12
primary_outcome.description: Neovascular membrane activity (measured by leakage) assessed by Investigator at Visit 4, as part of SOC, using standard clinical methods practiced (fluorescein or indocyanine green angiography); Categories included increased, unchanged or decreased neovascular membrane activity.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With a Change in Activity of Neovascular Membrane at Week 18
primary_outcome.description: Neovascular membrane activity (measured by leakage) assessed by Investigator at Visit 5, as part of SOC, using standard clinical methods practiced (fluorescein or indocyanine green angiography); Categories included increased, unchanged or decreased neovascular membrane activity.

primary_outcome.description: Neovascular membrane activity (measured by leakage) assessed by Investigator at Visit 6, as part of SOC, using standard clinical methods practiced (fluorescein or indocyanine green angiography); Categories included increased, unchanged or decreased neovascular membrane activity.

primary_outcome.description: Neovascular membrane activity (measured by leakage) assessed by Investigator at Visit 10, as part of SOC, using standard clinical methods practiced (fluorescein or indocyanine green angiography); Categories included increased, unchanged or decreased neovascular membrane activity.

primary_outcome.description: Neovascular membrane activity (measured by leakage) assessed by Investigator at Visit 11, as part of SOC, using standard clinical methods practiced (fluorescein or indocyanine green angiography); Categories included increased, unchanged or decreased neovascular membrane activity.

primary_outcome.description: Neovascular membrane activity (measured by leakage) assessed by Investigator at Visit 12, as part of SOC, using standard clinical methods practiced (fluorescein or indocyanine green angiography); Categories included increased, unchanged or decreased neovascular membrane activity.

primary_outcome.description: Neovascular membrane activity (measured by leakage) assessed by Investigator at Visit 13, as part of SOC, using standard clinical methods practiced (fluorescein or indocyanine green angiography); Categories included increased, unchanged or decreased neovascular membrane activity.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With a Change in Activity of Neovascular Membrane at Week 72
primary_outcome.description: Neovascular membrane activity (measured by leakage) assessed by Investigator at Visit 14, as part of SOC, using standard clinical methods practiced (fluorescein or indocyanine green angiography); Categories included increased, unchanged or decreased neovascular membrane activity.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With a Change in Activity of Neovascular Membrane at Last Visit
primary_outcome.description: Neovascular membrane activity (measured by leakage) assessed by Investigator at the Last Visit, as part of SOC, using standard clinical methods practiced (fluorescein or indocyanine green angiography); Categories included increased, unchanged or decreased neovascular membrane activity. Last Visit: last available postbaseline value.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Pigment Epithelial Detachment (PED) at Baseline
primary_outcome.description: PED assessed by Investigator at baseline as part of SOC for participants with age-related macular degeneration; Standard clinical methods practiced (fluorescein or indocyanine green angiography); Categories included present or absent.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With PED at Week 6
primary_outcome.description: PED assessed by Investigator at Visit 3, as part of SOC, using standard clinical methods practiced (fluorescein or indocyanine green angiography); Categories included present or absent.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With PED at Week 12
primary_outcome.description: PED assessed by Investigator at Visit 4, as part of SOC, using standard clinical methods practiced (fluorescein or indocyanine green angiography); Categories included present or absent.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With PED at Week 18
primary_outcome.description: PED assessed by Investigator at Visit 5, as part of SOC, using standard clinical methods practiced (fluorescein or indocyanine green angiography); Categories included present or absent.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With PED at Week 24
primary_outcome.description: PED assessed by Investigator at Visit 6, as part of SOC, using standard clinical methods practiced (fluorescein or indocyanine green angiography); Categories included present or absent.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With PED at Week 30
primary_outcome.description: PED assessed by Investigator at Visit 7, as part of SOC, using standard clinical methods practiced (fluorescein or indocyanine green angiography); Categories included present or absent.

primary_outcome.description: PED assessed by Investigator at Visit 10, as part of SOC, using standard clinical methods practiced (fluorescein or indocyanine green angiography); Categories included present or absent.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With PED at Week 54
primary_outcome.description: PED assessed by Investigator Visit 11, as part of SOC, using standard clinical methods practiced (fluorescein or indocyanine green angiography); Categories included present or absent.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With PED at Last Visit
primary_outcome.description: PED assessed by Investigator at Last Visit, as part of SOC, using standard clinical methods practiced (fluorescein or indocyanine green angiography); Categories included present or absent. Last Visit: last available postbaseline value.

primary_outcome.measure: Central Retinal Thickness
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 6 weeks up to Month 24 or early termination
primary_outcome.description: Central retinal thickness assessed by Investigator every 6 weeks, as part of SOC, using standard clinical methods practiced (optical coherence tomography) and reported as mean central retinal thickness. The timeframe was as follows: Visit 1: before first injection; Visit 3: 6 weeks after first injection (second injection).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Angiographic Subtype Reported at Baseline
primary_outcome.description: Angiographic subtype assessed by Investigator at Baseline, as part of SOC, using standard clinical methods practiced (fluorescein angiography or indocyanine green angiography) and the percent [%] classic fraction categories included unclear, occult (0% classic), minimally classic (1-49% classic), predominantly classic (50-99% classic), and pure classic (100% classic).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Angiographic Subtype Reported at Week 6
primary_outcome.description: Angiographic subtype assessed by Investigator at Visit 3, as part of SOC, using standard clinical methods practiced (fluorescein angiography or indocyanine green angiography) and the percent [%] classic fraction categories included unclear, occult (0% classic), minimally classic (1-49% classic), predominantly classic (50-99% classic), and pure classic (100% classic).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Angiographic Subtype Reported at Week 12
primary_outcome.description: Angiographic subtype assessed by Investigator at Visit 4, as part of SOC, using standard clinical methods practiced (fluorescein angiography or indocyanine green angiography) and the percent [%] classic fraction categories included unclear, occult (0% classic), minimally classic (1-49% classic), predominantly classic (50-99% classic), and pure classic (100% classic).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Angiographic Subtype Reported at Week 18
primary_outcome.description: Angiographic subtype assessed by Investigator at Visit 5, as part of SOC, using standard clinical methods practiced (fluorescein angiography or indocyanine green angiography) and the percent [%] classic fraction categories included unclear, occult (0% classic), minimally classic (1-49% classic), predominantly classic (50-99% classic), and pure classic (100% classic).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Angiographic Subtype Reported at Week 24
primary_outcome.description: Angiographic subtype assessed by Investigator at Visit 6, as part of SOC, using standard clinical methods practiced (fluorescein angiography or indocyanine green angiography) and the percent [%] classic fraction categories included unclear, occult (0% classic), minimally classic (1-49% classic), predominantly classic (50-99% classic), and pure classic (100% classic).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Angiographic Subtype Reported at Week 30
primary_outcome.description: Angiographic subtype assessed by Investigator at Visit 7, as part of SOC, using standard clinical methods practiced (fluorescein angiography or indocyanine green angiography) and the percent (%) classic fraction categories included unclear, occult (0% classic), minimally classic (1-49% classic), predominantly classic (50-99% classic), and pure classic (100% classic).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Angiographic Subtype Reported at Week 36
primary_outcome.description: Angiographic subtype assessed by Investigator at Visit 8, as part of SOC, using standard clinical methods practiced (fluorescein angiography or indocyanine green angiography) and the % classic fraction categories included unclear, occult (0% classic), minimally classic (1-49% classic), predominantly classic (50-99% classic), and pure classic (100% classic).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Angiographic Subtype Reported at Week 42
primary_outcome.description: Angiographic subtype assessed by Investigator at Visit 9, as part of SOC, using standard clinical methods practiced (fluorescein angiography or indocyanine green angiography) and the % classic fraction categories included unclear, occult (0% classic), minimally classic (1-49% classic), predominantly classic (50-99% classic), and pure classic (100% classic).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Angiographic Subtype Reported at Week 48
primary_outcome.description: Angiographic subtype assessed by Investigator at Visit 10, as part of SOC, using standard clinical methods practiced (fluorescein angiography or indocyanine green angiography) and the % classic fraction categories included unclear, occult (0% classic), minimally classic (1-49% classic), predominantly classic (50-99% classic), and pure classic (100% classic).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Angiographic Subtype Reported at Week 54
primary_outcome.description: Angiographic subtype assessed by Investigator at Visit 11, as part of SOC, using standard clinical methods practiced (fluorescein angiography or indocyanine green angiography) and the % classic fraction categories included unclear, occult (0% classic), minimally classic (1-49% classic), predominantly classic (50-99% classic), and pure classic (100% classic).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Angiographic Subtype Reported at Last Visit
primary_outcome.description: Angiographic subtype assessed by Investigator at the Last Visit, as part of SOC, using standard clinical methods practiced (fluorescein angiography or indocyanine green angiography) and the % classic fraction categories included unclear, occult (0% classic), minimally classic (1-49% classic), predominantly classic (50-99% classic), and pure classic (100% classic). Last Visit: last available postbaseline value.

intervention.description: Dosage recommendations for MACUGEN took place on the basis of the approved Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC) and were adjusted solely according to medical practice. MACUGENÂ® is available as pre-filled syringe containing 0.3 mg MACUGENÂ® in 90 ÂµL injection solution for intravitreal injection. Macugen injections were documented to reflect the routine clinical practice. Follow-up visits were only carried out and documented if they took place as part of the standard medical treatment for the respective case and were necessary for medical and/or therapeutic reasons.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with neovascular age-related macular degeneration

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with neovascular age-related macular degeneration
Exclusion Criteria:

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: This observational study did not define endpoints as primary or secondary. All endpoints arbitrarily assigned as primary for reporting results.

group.title: Macugen
group.description: Intraocular injections of Macugen (pegaptanib) into the study eye. The usage and dosage recommendations were in accordance with the Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC) and based exclusively on the medical and therapeutic needs.

group.title: Macugen
group.description: Intraocular injections of Macugen (pegaptanib) into the study eye. The usage and dosage recommendations were in accordance with the Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC) and based exclusively on the medical and therapeutic needs.

measure.title: Age
Gender, Customized

outcome.title: Visual Acuity (VA)
outcome.description: VA measured at each follow-up visit as the number of lines read on a standard eye chart (Snellen or Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study [EDTRS]) using a 5 meter distance, 1 meter distance, or verifying if participant was able to count fingers, perceive hand motion, or light. Follow-up visits occurred only if considered part of standard medical treatment. The timeframe was as follows: Visit 1: before first injection; Visit 2: first injection; Visit 3: 6 weeks after first injection (second injection).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 6 weeks up to Month 24 or early termination
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS):participants who received at least 1 Macugen (pegaptanib) injection and had at least 1 VA measurement postbaseline. Participants with light perception or no light perception any time during study were excluded from FAS; N=participants with evaluable data; Last Visit: last available postbaseline value.

group.title: Macugen
group.description: Intraocular injections of Macugen (pegaptanib) into the study eye. The usage and dosage recommendations were in accordance with the Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC) and based exclusively on the medical and therapeutic needs.

measure.title: Visual Acuity (VA)
measure.description: VA measured at each follow-up visit as the number of lines read on a standard eye chart (Snellen or Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study [EDTRS]) using a 5 meter distance, 1 meter distance, or verifying if participant was able to count fingers, perceive hand motion, or light. Follow-up visits occurred only if considered part of standard medical treatment. The timeframe was as follows: Visit 1: before first injection; Visit 2: first injection; Visit 3: 6 weeks after first injection (second injection).
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS):participants who received at least 1 Macugen (pegaptanib) injection and had at least 1 VA measurement postbaseline. Participants with light perception or no light perception any time during study were excluded from FAS; N=participants with evaluable data; Last Visit: last available postbaseline value.

outcome.title: Vision-related Functioning and Quality of Life Using the National Eye Institute Visual Functioning Questionnaire-25 (NEI-VFQ-25): Overall Composite Score
outcome.description: Participant-reported vision-related functioning and quality of life measured using the 25 item NEI-VFQ-25. Converted scale 0-100 where higher score represented better functioning: General Health: item 1; General Vision: item 2; Ocular Pain: 4,19; Near Vision: 5,6,7; Distance Vision: 8,9,14; Social Functioning: 11,13; Mental Health Activities: 3,21,22,25; Role Difficulties: 17,18; Dependency: 20,23,24; Driving: 15c,16, 16a; Color Vision: 12; Peripheral Vision: 10.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 6 months up to Month 24 or early termination
outcome.population: FAS; N=number of participants with evaluable data; Last Visit: last available postbaseline value.

group.description: Intraocular injections of Macugen (pegaptanib) into the study eye. The usage and dosage recommendations were in accordance with the Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC) and based exclusively on the medical and therapeutic needs.

measure.title: Vision-related Functioning and Quality of Life Using the National Eye Institute Visual Functioning Questionnaire-25 (NEI-VFQ-25): Overall Composite Score
measure.description: Participant-reported vision-related functioning and quality of life measured using the 25 item NEI-VFQ-25. Converted scale 0-100 where higher score represented better functioning: General Health: item 1; General Vision: item 2; Ocular Pain: 4,19; Near Vision: 5,6,7; Distance Vision: 8,9,14; Social Functioning: 11,13; Mental Health Activities: 3,21,22,25; Role Difficulties: 17,18; Dependency: 20,23,24; Driving: 15c,16, 16a; Color Vision: 12; Peripheral Vision: 10.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Investigator Assessments of Efficacy
outcome.description: Investigator's categorical assessment of the efficacy of Macugen (pegaptanib) treatment at the final visit or termination of therapy; Categories included Very Good, Good, Moderate, and Poor.
outcome.population: FAS; N = number of participants with evaluable data.

outcome.title: Lesion Size (Number of Optic Disc Areas)
outcome.description: Lesion size measured by Investigator after each injection as part of standard of care (SOC), using standard clinical methods practiced (fluorescein or indocyanine green angiography); Reported as the number of optic-disk areas, each of which were 2.54 millimeters squared (mm^2). Lesion size included choroidal neovascularization, exudation area, and hemorrhage, if present. The timeframe was as follows: Visit 1: before first injection; Visit 3: 6 weeks after first injection (second injection).

outcome.title: Central Retinal Thickness
outcome.description: Central retinal thickness assessed by Investigator every 6 weeks, as part of SOC, using standard clinical methods practiced (optical coherence tomography) and reported as mean central retinal thickness. The timeframe was as follows: Visit 1: before first injection; Visit 3: 6 weeks after first injection (second injection).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 6 weeks up to Month 24 or early termination
outcome.population: FAS; N=number of participants with evaluable data; Last Visit: last available postbaseline value.

group.title: Macugen
group.description: Intraocular injections of Macugen (pegaptanib) into the study eye. The usage and dosage recommendations were in accordance with the Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC) and based exclusively on the medical and therapeutic needs.

measure.title: Central Retinal Thickness
measure.description: Central retinal thickness assessed by Investigator every 6 weeks, as part of SOC, using standard clinical methods practiced (optical coherence tomography) and reported as mean central retinal thickness. The timeframe was as follows: Visit 1: before first injection; Visit 3: 6 weeks after first injection (second injection).
measure.population: FAS; N=number of participants with evaluable data; Last Visit: last available postbaseline value.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Angiographic Subtype Reported at Baseline
outcome.description: Angiographic subtype assessed by Investigator at Baseline, as part of SOC, using standard clinical methods practiced (fluorescein angiography or indocyanine green angiography) and the percent [%] classic fraction categories included unclear, occult (0% classic), minimally classic (1-49% classic), predominantly classic (50-99% classic), and pure classic (100% classic).
outcome.population: FAS; N=number of participants with evaluable data.

group.title: Macugen
group.description: Intraocular injections of Macugen (pegaptanib) into the study eye. The usage and dosage recommendations were in accordance with the Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC) and based exclusively on the medical and therapeutic needs.

outcome.title: Time to First Adverse Event (AE)
outcome.description: Time to first AE during the study evaluated by Kaplan-Meier Product-limit methods. AE:any untoward medical occurrence in a participant administered a product or medical device in the context of study; the event need not necessarily have a causal relationship with the treatment or usage.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to Month 24 or early termination
outcome.population: Safety Set: all participants who received at least 1 Macugen (pegaptanib) injection and provided data post baseline. Data not analyzed due to low number of AEs.

group.title: Macugen
group.description: Intraocular injections of Macugen (pegaptanib) into the study eye. The usage and dosage recommendations were in accordance with the Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC) and based exclusively on the medical and therapeutic needs.

measure.title: Time to First Adverse Event (AE)
measure.description: Time to first AE during the study evaluated by Kaplan-Meier Product-limit methods. AE:any untoward medical occurrence in a participant administered a product or medical device in the context of study; the event need not necessarily have a causal relationship with the treatment or usage.
measure.population: Safety Set: all participants who received at least 1 Macugen (pegaptanib) injection and provided data post baseline. Data not analyzed due to low number of AEs.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Complications Associated With Injection
outcome.description: Complications associated with injection during the study with onset at or after date of first injection was recorded by the Investigator.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to Month 24 or early termination
outcome.population: Safety Set; N=number of participants with evaluable data.

group.title: Macugen
group.description: Intraocular injections of Macugen (pegaptanib) into the study eye. The usage and dosage recommendations were in accordance with the Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC) and based exclusively on the medical and therapeutic needs.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Complications Associated With Injection
measure.description: Complications associated with injection during the study with onset at or after date of first injection was recorded by the Investigator.
measure.population: Safety Set; N=number of participants with evaluable data.

outcome.title: Treatment Tolerability
outcome.description: Investigator's overall evaluation of tolerability; Categories included: Very Good, Good, Moderate, and Poor.
outcome.population: Safety Set; N=number of participants with evaluable data.

group.title: Macugen
group.description: Intraocular injections of Macugen (pegaptanib) into the study eye. The usage and dosage recommendations were in accordance with the Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC) and based exclusively on the medical and therapeutic needs.

measure.title: Treatment Tolerability
measure.description: Investigator's overall evaluation of tolerability; Categories included: Very Good, Good, Moderate, and Poor.
measure.population: Safety Set; N=number of participants with evaluable data.

outcome.title: Intraocular Pressure (IOP)
outcome.description: IOP measured at each visit using either applanation tonometry or non-contact before intraviterial injection, reported as pre-dose pressure of treated eye in millimeters of mercury (mmHg). The timeframe was as follows: Visit 1: IOP before any injection; Visit 2: IOP before first injection; Visit 3: IOP before second injection.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 6 weeks up to Month 24 or early termination
outcome.population: Safety Set; N=number of participants with evaluable data; Last Visit: last available postbaseline value.

group.title: Macugen
group.description: Intraocular injections of Macugen (pegaptanib) into the study eye. The usage and dosage recommendations were in accordance with the Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC) and based exclusively on the medical and therapeutic needs.

measure.title: Intraocular Pressure (IOP)
measure.description: IOP measured at each visit using either applanation tonometry or non-contact before intraviterial injection, reported as pre-dose pressure of treated eye in millimeters of mercury (mmHg). The timeframe was as follows: Visit 1: IOP before any injection; Visit 2: IOP before first injection; Visit 3: IOP before second injection.
measure.population: Safety Set; N=number of participants with evaluable data; Last Visit: last available postbaseline value.

outcome.title: Change in IOP Between Predose and Postdose Assessment
outcome.description: IOP measured at each visit using either applanation tonometry or non-contact before and after intraviterial injection. Change in IOP equals postdose IOP minus predose IOP.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 6 weeks up to Month 24 or early termination
outcome.population: Safety Set; N=number of participants with evaluable data; Last Visit: last available postbaseline value.

group.title: Macugen
group.description: Intraocular injections of Macugen (pegaptanib) into the study eye. The usage and dosage recommendations were in accordance with the Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC) and based exclusively on the medical and therapeutic needs.

measure.title: Change in IOP Between Predose and Postdose Assessment
measure.description: IOP measured at each visit using either applanation tonometry or non-contact before and after intraviterial injection. Change in IOP equals postdose IOP minus predose IOP.
measure.population: Safety Set; N=number of participants with evaluable data; Last Visit: last available postbaseline value.

outcome.title: IOP Mean Difference (Within a Participant)
outcome.description: Average predose minus postdose mean difference in IOP within a participant
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 6 weeks up to Month 24 or early termination
outcome.population: Safety Set; N=number of participants with evaluable data.

group.title: Macugen
group.description: Intraocular injections of Macugen (pegaptanib) into the study eye. The usage and dosage recommendations were in accordance with the Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC) and based exclusively on the medical and therapeutic needs.

measure.title: IOP Mean Difference (Within a Participant)
measure.description: Average predose minus postdose mean difference in IOP within a participant
measure.population: Safety Set; N=number of participants with evaluable data.

reported_events.desc: The Safety population (N=816) is less than total number of participants in study (1001) because some participants had a baseline visit but no injection or no data post baseline. The same event may appear as both an adverse event (AE) and a serious adverse event (SAE). However, what is presented are distinct events.

group.title: Macugen
group.description: Intraocular injections of Macugen (pegaptanib) into the study eye. The usage and dosage recommendations were in accordance with the Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC) and based exclusively on the medical and therapeutic needs.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Time to first AE not estimated due to insufficient number of events. Visit numbers for NEI-VFQ-25 deviated from numbering used in other analyses; it represents the sequence number of questionaries administered (Visit 1=first assessment, etc.).
